title: STEEM Economics and Trade Theory - Van Kush Perspective (2016)
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Foundational economic education from early STEEM era

trade_instruments_theory.core_principle: Currencies don't contain value - they REPRESENT value

examples.stocks: Represent share of company, company does work that creates value

iraq_example.event: ISIS soldiers stole gold from Bank of Mosul
iraq_example.result: Iraqi Dinar worth less (no gold backing + civil war)
iraq_example.prediction: If Iraq becomes peaceful, Dinar would rise

trade_volume.definition: How many people buying/selling a currency or stock

inflation.definition: Currency worth less, takes more to buy same goods
inflation.crypto_warning: Coins with no cap will inflate into eternity unless high trade volume

supply_and_demand.definition: How many people want something vs how many exist
supply_and_demand.example: New iPhone high value → ages → value drops

whales.definition: Person with large quantity of trade instrument
whales.power: 51% ownership can crash price (sell all) or inflate (hold all making rare)

bubbles.gasoline_reality: Will probably be replaced by ethanol before running out

trading_strategies.arbitrage: Buy coins on one site, sell on another for more (better Crypto-to-Crypto)
trading_strategies.create_value: Use coins to buy software/textbooks, create products
trading_strategies.promote: Share favorite coins on social media
trading_strategies.create_currency: Satoshi gave out Bitcoin source code for this
trading_strategies.create_exchange: Transaction fees earn coins, help fledgling altcoins
trading_strategies.spot_price: When trading for precious metals, buy as close to global spot as possible
trading_strategies.foreign_investment: Don't think America is the be-all end-all

real_assets_priority.philosophy: Trade instruments at highest value, buy real items
real_assets_priority.cycle: Use real items to get more trade instruments

first_30000_post_analysis.significance: Beginning of truly Decentralized Social Media

steem_power_distribution_theory.problem: Early adopters/creators had only high SP accounts
steem_power_distribution_theory.mechanism: $30k post = at least $15k in STEEM Power
steem_power_distribution_theory.effect: New high-SP accounts vote for different things

steem_value_drivers.savings_pool: Tons planning to save up and buy STEEM
steem_value_drivers.bitcoiner_conversion: Large pool of Bitcoiners haven't converted yet

related_posts.taxes: You do not have to pay taxes on cryptocurrencies until you sell them
related_posts.steem_value: STEEM's USD value will climb throughout the year

community_commentary.justtryme90: Great post, she deserved the reward

community_commentary.kaylinart: Topics that can be upvoted are changing

bitcoin_halving_analysis.source: How the Bitcoin Halving Event is a Good Thing - @marsresident 2016
bitcoin_halving_analysis.event: Mining reward halving to 12.5 Bitcoins per block
common_concerns: Will another coin take its place?
What happens when there are no more to mine?

problem_1_limit.concern: Bitcoin will die when mining rewards end
problem_1_limit.reality: Transactions still mined/verified by pools mining multiple coins
problem_1_limit.survival: Bitcoin lives as long as people hold it AND mine altcoins
problem_1_limit.mechanism: Mining pools mine BTC + LTC + DOGE together

problem_2_small_amounts.prediction: Future: people trade Satoshis, not Bitcoins

halving_effect.behavior: Miners hoard coins for lifetime supply

market_dynamics.large_btc_crash: Scares people to fiat, altcoins SUFFER
market_dynamics.altcoin_growth: Makes Bitcoin MORE stable over time

problem_3_altcoins.stability_prediction: Less likely to ever return to $30, $5, or $0

bitcoin_halving_analysis.conclusion: Do not fear the halving - it was planned for a long time

temple_coin_connection.philosophy: Coins as trade instruments, not ends in themselves

quiz_questions.q: What's the difference between trade instruments and real value?
quiz_questions.a: Trade instruments REPRESENT value, real assets CONTAIN value
quiz_questions.explanation: Precious metals, land, machines contain actual value

quiz_questions.a: They inflate into eternity unless high trade volume
quiz_questions.explanation: Need demand to offset infinite supply

quiz_questions.q: What was the first $30,000 STEEM post?
quiz_questions.explanation: Marked beginning of decentralized social media

quiz_questions.q: What happens when Bitcoin mining rewards end?
quiz_questions.a: Transactions still verified by pools mining multiple coins (BTC + altcoins)
quiz_questions.explanation: Bitcoin survives as long as people hold it AND mine altcoins

quiz_questions.q: What is a Satoshi and why was it created?
quiz_questions.a: 0.00000001 Bitcoin - created because amounts got too small to trade
quiz_questions.explanation: Future prediction: people will trade Satoshis, not Bitcoins
